greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)=smallest number that gives a product with the sum of digits of n written in base 2 greater than n.
formula: Let sd2(n) the sum of digits of n written in base 2. Then a(n) =1 + Floor(n/sd2(n)).
example: 9 is written 1001 in base 2, then sd2(9)=2; 4*2<9<5*2; then (c,9)=5
results.author: Philippe LALLOUET (philip.lallouet(AT)wanadoo.fr), Jul 27 2007
